dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo

  • public class DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Ground Station MIssion Push Info Class

    While the aircraft is executing a ground station mission, information about the current status of the mission is stored in this structure. This structure is used in the DJIGroundStationMIssionPushInfoCallback interface, which is called when the mobile device receives information pushed from the aircraft.
    Developers can use this class with DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallback to monitor and notify users of the current state of the ground station mission execution.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStation, DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallback

    • Field Detail

      • missionType

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationStatusPushType missionType
        The type of mission being executed. Four possible values:
        0 - Attitude
        1 - Waypoint
        2 - Hot Point
        3 - Follow Me
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation

      • targetWayPointIndex

        public int targetWayPointIndex
        While the aircraft is executing a waypoint mission, this gives the waypoint index of the waypoint the aircraft is flying towards. If the aircraft is currently executing actions at a waypoint, targetWaypointIndex will be the index of the waypoint the aircraft is currently at. The moment the aircraft finishes executing its actions, targetWaypointIndex will update to the index of the next waypoint. The value of this property will be set to -1 if the ground station task has not started yet.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint, DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo

      • currState

        public int currState
        To be used when executing a waypoint mission. Identifies what the aircraft is currently doing. There are 6 possible values:
        0 - Initializing waypoint mission
        1 - Moving between waypoints
        2 - Rotating at a waypoint
        3 - Executing an action at a waypoint
        4 - Has reached a waypoint and will shortly be performing actions
        5 - At a waypoint, and has finished executing actions at that waypoint
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • errorNotification

        public int errorNotification
        The navigation mission's error status.

      • reserved

        public int reserved
        This attribute is used for internal purposes. Please ignore, do not modify.

      • hotPointMissionStatus

        public int hotPointMissionStatus
        While the aircraft is executing a hot point mission, this gives the status of the aircraft. There are three possible values:
        0 - Initializing. The aircraft is travelling to its starting point in the hot point orbit
        1 - Moving. The aircraft is orbiting the hot point.
        2 - Waiting. The aircraft is waiting. This occurs when pauseHotPoint is called in DJIGroundStation.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation, DJIHotPointInitializationInfo

      • hotPointRadius

        public int hotPointRadius
        While the aircraft is executing a hot point mission, this gives the radius, in centimeters, of the aircraft's orbit.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation, DJIHotPointInitializationInfo

      • hotPointReason

        public int hotPointReason
        Hot point reason.

      • followMeMissionStatus

        public int followMeMissionStatus
        While the aircraft is executing a follow me mission, this gives the status of the aircraft. There are three possible values:
        0 - Initializing follow me mission
        1 - Moving
        2 - Waiting
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation, DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

      • followMeGpsLevel

        public int followMeGpsLevel
        While the aircraft is executing a follow me mission, this gives the strength of the GPS signal. There are 6 levels of strength:
        0 - No GPS signal
        1 - GPS signal very weak. This is the minimum GPS signal strength required to go home.
        2 - GPS signal weak.
        3 - GPS signal moderate.
        4 - GPS signal strong.
        5 - GPS signal very strong.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation, DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

      • followMeDistance

        public int followMeDistance
        While the aircraft is executing a follow me mission, this gives the distance, in centimeters, between the aircraft and the mobile device it is following.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation, DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

      • followMeReason

        public int followMeReason
        Follow me reason.
